channel.title: Help with PI! (Should be easy to solve)
channel.description:
Got some questions about PI (Deathlypvpz)
1.) How can i change this interface to the right one? [IMG]http://i43.tinypic.com/2it1k6c.png[/img]
2.) How can i change this icons to new ones i made? And how can i change the tabs to oldschool ones? [IMG]http://i39.tinypic.com/2cx6bfr.png[/img]
3.) How can i make the frame of the client blue? And how can i change the icon to a random one?
Thanks for your time :)

item.title: Help with PI! (Should be easy to solve)
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

I’m not too into clients. And exactly what did you want changed about that frame?
Look into RSFrame.java

Read full topic
item.source: Help with PI! (Should be easy to solve)

item.title: Help with PI! (Should be easy to solve)
item.dc:creator: @rspscode rspscode
item.description:
@rspscode wrote:

This one:

2csdx8x.png777×543

Also can you explain or show me a guide about this?

Because the sprites arent there.

Read full topic
item.source: Help with PI! (Should be easy to solve)

item.title: Help with PI! (Should be easy to solve)
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“rspscode, post:3, topic:528330”]I have already tried that.

It isnt there.
And i mean the client frame not the game frame.[/quote]
Okay, show me what you mean by that…
And there is sprites, that’s how it’s added. And if not then it’s cache packed. You need to get toms cache editor, and dump the sprites, then edit them, and then repack them. (With the correct name.)

Read full topic
item.source: Help with PI! (Should be easy to solve)

item.title: Help with PI! (Should be easy to solve)
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

This is all basic sprite editing. Go into your cache, and find the folder that says “Gameframe” There’s a bunch of .png’s in there. That will edit your game frame.
Also, in the cache, find The folder for spirtes, then the one for interfaces, in there should be that skill tab.
Edit that.

Read full topic
item.source: Help with PI! (Should be easy to solve)
